page.title: 01CHARD
page.content: Chard is a small town in South Somerset of approximately 12,000 people. It is situated on the side of Snowdon Hill.There are two springs on the Hill,the rivers flow down either side of Fore Street.One flows South into the English Channel,the other one flows North into the Bristol Channel. The A30 runs straight through the town from East to West as does the A358 from North to South. A market is held every Saturday and Thursday.It is a 'bit and bob' market, (the farmers send their animals to market in Taunton)Chard has the usual small shops and 3 small supermarkets.A number of Chard people work in factories,some are food-related,others are engineering companies.Two old lace mills and the Guildhall are the tallest buildings in town.
